modName: Vampire Armor Set with Deathbrand Stats
summary: A new vampire armor set that has the same AC as the Deathbrand set from Dragonborn.
descriptionHtml:
I was disappointed that the vampire royal armor from Dawnguard was so weak. I thought that it should at least be comparable to the Dawnguard's armor, but it's not. So, I changed it. Simply press ~ and type "player.additem (FORMID) (NUMBER)" without quotes, replacing (FORMID) with the form ID and (NUMBER) with the quantity you desire. The "xx" part of the form ID depends on your load order; if you load this mod after Skyrim, Update.esm, and Dawnguard, then "xx" would be "03", for example.

For those who don't have Dragonborn, the Deathbrand armor is an ancient armor set that is more powerful even than Daedric armor because it has a unique +100 bonus to armor when the entire set is worn. I liked the insane armor rating, obviously, but I liked how the vampire armor looked. Besides, a vampire clan that has survived for millennia should have some extremely good armor, instead of something that is more flimsy than scaled armor.

Below, I've listed what I've changed.

Vampire Gauntlets
FormID:xx002F9B
AC: 11.5 (same as Deathbrand)

Vampire Royal Armor
FormID:xx002F9A
AC: 155.5 (Deathbrand cuirass, special bonus, and helmet stats combined)

Vampire Boots
FormID:xx002F9D
AC: 11.5 (Same as Deathbrand)

Note: Obviously, this will be extremely overpowered if you use ANY helmet. I also chose not to enchant any item other than the Royal Armor, which grants a 125% increase in Magicka regeneration. I only intended to make essentially a Vampire Armor copy with Deathbrand Armor stats.

OTHER MODS I RECOMMEND (these were used in my screenshots):
Skyrim HD- makes everything beautiful, if your computer can handle it.

Dawnguard Fortress Improved High Resolution 2K and Castle Volkihar HD Retexture by HXP- makes Fort Dawnguard and Castle Volkihar look much better.

Xenius Character Enhancement and XCE-Dawnguard by Xenius- makes faces MUCH better. The Dawnguard version even lets you get the "batlike" appearance of NPC vampires (wrinkled nose, higher brow, etc).


Feel free to comment and suggest other things for me to do, but I'm still a novice modder. I may not make anything new soon, and my real life will be my priority for now.
author: reapthesystem
